channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nonprofits are finally figuring out how to get disillusioned Gen Zers to fix their own communities: You just have to give them money
item.description: It's the latest example of how organizations are trying to empower and encourage Gen Z to get involved in philanthropy.

item.title: Macy’s latest earnings show the CEO’s turnaround plan is working despite a looming tariff threat
item.description: Wall Street thinks it could have been much worse for the beleaguered department store chain.

item.title: In Oklahoma, Role-Playing Battles Borrow From the Russia-Ukraine War
item.description: In the U.S., the re-enactment of historical battles has long been a niche hobby. But fake battles that echo an ongoing war are a relatively recent phe...

item.title: At Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Trial, Testimony About a Break-in at Kid Cudi’s Home
item.description: A Los Angeles police officer said that he observed a Cadillac Escalade with a license plate registered to Bad Boy Productions, Inc. leave the scene.

item.title: Exclusive: Stablecoin company Conduit raises $36 million from Dragonfly Capital and Altos Ventures
item.description: The company will use the money raised to expand into Asia and diversify its client base.

item.title: The Fortune 500 in 1972: 116 consumer products in one beautiful collage
Beware: We Are Entering a New Phase of the Trump Era
item.description: I’ve seen the signs before. I’m seeing them now.

item.title: Germany Says It Will Step Up Weapons Support for Ukraine as Zelensky Visits
item.description: In the latest sign of a warming relationship, President Volodymyr Zelensky met in Berlin with Chancellor Friedrich Merz, who said Germany would increa...

item.title: How to watch the Scripps National Spelling Bee—and how much money is on the line
item.description: 99 young quarterfinalists are left to duke it out.

item.title: Trump vs. Harvard
item.description: Inside the president’s battle with the university.

item.title: Joël Le Scouarnec, French Doctor Who Molested Hundreds of Children, Is Sentenced
item.description: A former surgeon confessed to abusing at least 299 people, mostly children, in what is considered the largest case of its kind in French history.

item.title: Germany Says It Will Step Up Weapons Support for Ukraine as Zelensky Visits
item.description: In the latest sign of a warming relationship, President Volodymyr Zelensky met in Berlin with Chancellor Friedrich Merz, who said Germany would increa...

item.title: Japan Welcomes a New Sumo Champ. Surprise: He’s Japanese.
item.description: Onosato Daiki became the first Japanese man in eight years to be named a yokozuna, or grand champion, the highest title in the sport.

item.title: Turkey Cracks Down on Fliers Who Stand Up Too Soon, Threatening Fines
item.description: As of this month, passengers who stand before planes fully stop may be fined by the Turkish government.

item.title: What to Know About the Liverpool FC Parade Car Crash
item.description: Almost 80 people, including four children, were injured on Monday after a driver plowed into a crowd that had been celebrating Liverpool F.C.’s Premie...
